info.title: TransFollow REST API
info.description:
Welcome to TransFollow documentation!

Important info

  • All `date-time` values are formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`
  • All `date` values are formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

get.description: Monitoring services use this endpoint to see if HTTP service is well. Returns build version and current compatibility version (see reference).

post.description:
#### OAuth 2 Token call
Most of the TransFollow server calls need the user to be authenticated. TransFollow uses the OAuth2 authentication
scheme. Upon calling this endpoint the client will receive a short lived access token, and a refresh token.

##### Access Token
The access token is used for authenticating with the TransFollow server, and is added to every request using
the `Authorization` header. The access token is short lived, and will expire after a fixed amount of time. This
amount of time is returned in the response.

##### Refresh Token
The refresh token is used when the access token has expired. Using the refresh token the client is able to
retrieve a new set of access / refresh tokens. To request the new set, call this endpoint using the `grant_type`
of `refresh_token`, and provide the `refresh_token` field in the submitted body.

#### Account Secret
When a login is successful the response includes a field which is not specific to OAuth2: the `accountSecret`
field. The AccountSecret is a randomly generated string,  only accessible by the server, and by clients logging
in with its corresponding account. It is used to generate Message Authentication Codes (MAC) used for approvals.
The secret is generated when an account is created.

grant_type.description: Grant type indicates the authentication method, which can either be `password`, `refresh_token` or `authorization_code`. Using the `password` method, a `username` and `password` are required to be sent with the request. When using the `refresh_token` method the previously received `refresh_token` should be sent with the request. (With the `authorization_code` and a GET method a third party can pick up a token on behalf of a registered user).

username.description: Your TransFollow username. This field is required when `grant_type` is `password`.

refresh_token.description: Refresh Token. This field is required when `grant_type` is `refresh_token`.

password.description: Your TransFollow password. This field is required when `grant_type` is `password`.

redirect_uri.description: Mandatory in combination with grant type `authorization_code`

post.description:
Creates a new subscription on this account. When a credit is used the subscription will execute a POST call to the callback URL.

To prevent unauthorized requests to the `callbackUrl` use HTTP Basic Auth to secure it and specify the credentials in the optional `basicAuthCredentials` field. If specified the POST callback from TransFollow to the `callbackUrl` will contain the appropriate `Authorization` header. The specified `callbackUrl` should respond with a `200` HTTP response code after processing the request.

get.description: Returns a list of all freight documents where the logged in user played a role. Cancelled freight documents will not be returned unless you ask for it using the status filter with eq or in operator. ne operator will never return cancelled.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
A means to filter out FreightDocuments from the result. Returns the freight documents that have their attributes matching the given value. ### Supported operations | Operation | Meaning | Notes | | --------- | --------------------- | - | | eq | equals | | | like | like | | | ne | not equals | | | lt | lower than | | | le | lower or equal than | | | gt | greater or equal than | | | in | is in set | When using 'in' operator, it must be enclosed in square brackets separated by a comma. See the example below. | ### Filterable attributes | Attribute | Supported operations | Notes | | ----------------------------- | -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | type | eq, ne | one of `WAYBILL`, `WAYBILL_FRA`, `WAYBILL_ESP`, `WAYBILL_CZE` | | establishedDate | lt, le, gt, ge | YYYY-MM-DD format | | lastModifiedDateTime | lt, le, gt, ge | ISO-8601 format accepting milliseconds. Example: 2014-03-31T22:13:45:789Z | | status | eq, ne, in | one of `DRAFT`, `ISSUED`, `TRANSIT`, `DELIVERED` or `CANCELLED`. | | estimatedDateTimeOfTakingOver | lt, le, gt, ge | ISO-8601 format. Example: 2014-03-31T22:00:00Z | | estimatedDateTimeOfDelivery | lt, le, gt, ge | ISO-8601 format. Example: 2014-03-31T22:00:00Z | | ownRoles | eq, ne, in | Role can be `SUBMITTER`, `CLIENT`, `CARRIER`, `CONSIGNOR`, `CONSIGNEE`, `SUBSEQUENTCARRIER`, `PLACEOFTAKINGOVER`, or `PLACEOFDELIVERY`. Will filter freight documents where the logged in user has a particular role. | | modifiedByOtherAccount (*) | eq | only value `true` is supported. Returns freight documents that were modified by a different account than the logged in user | | submitterEmail | eq | Must be a well formed email address. Returns freight documents that were submitted by an account with this email address | | transportReference | eq |   | | referenceValue | eq | Returns freight documents that contain a reference with this value. | (*) criteria will only be applied to non delivered nor cancelled freight documents
### Examples - All freight documents except cancelled of the currently logged in user that are of type waybill that are not draft and not issued and where the currently logged in user has consignee or consignor role and that were modified later than the specified date: `filters=type.eq.WAYBILL,status.ne.DRAFT,status.ne.ISSUED,ownRoles.in.[CONSIGNOR,CONSIGNEE],lastModifiedDateTime.gt.2014-02-10T00:00:00Z` - All freight documents except cancelled of the currently logged in user modified after the specified date by at least one other account: `filters=lastModifiedDateTime.ge.2017-10-24T11:45:00Z,modifiedByOtherAccount.eq.true` - All freight documents of the currently logged in user that are of type waybill that are draft or cancelled: `filters=type.eq.WAYBILL,status.in.[DRAFT,CANCELLED]` - All freight documents of a transport: `filters=transportReference.eq.MY_TRANSPORT`

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Order by these attributes, `.asc` and `.desc`:

### Sortable attributes

| Attribute                     | Notes                                               |
| ----------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| authorityReference            |                                                     |
| type                          | one of `WAYBILL`, `WAYBILL_FRA`, `WAYBILL_ESP`, `WAYBILL_CZE`          |
| establishedDate               | ISO-8601 date format: YYYY-MM-DD                    |
| lastModifiedDateTime          | ISO-8601 format. Example: 2014-03-31T22:00:00Z      |
| status                        | one of `DRAFT`, `ISSUED`, `TRANSIT`, or `DELIVERED` |
| estimatedDateTimeOfTakingOver | ISO-8601 format. Example: 2014-03-31T22:00:00Z      |
| estimatedDateTimeOfDelivery   | ISO-8601 format. Example: 2014-03-31T22:00:00Z      |

schema.description: Returns the total amount of freight documents available to the logged in user.

post.description:
A new Freight Document can be created by a logged in account. This account is the submitter. This account can also have another role on the new document. The user is allowed to save a draft version of the freight document. This draft version can only be edited and updated by the submitter. Once a freight document has been issued, it will no longer be editable and all mandatory fields are applicable. To create a draft, POST with field 'status' set to `DRAFT`. POSTing a freight document with the status set to `ISSUED` will save the document as issued and make it unchangeable. If the submitter account does not have sufficient credits the POST will fail with error 4.41.

Consignor, consignee and carrier are roles that are part of the freight document. Together with the submitter they represent the legal parties in the freight document. The consignee actually becomes a legal party on the freight document when he receives the cargo, signs the freight document or files a claim. The place of taking over, place of delivery and substitute carriers are never legal parties on the freight document and, with the exception of place of taking over, they can be added to the freight document after it's creation in `DRAFT`.

When the freight document is saved (both in `DRAFT` and `ISSUED` status) an email will be sent out to the roles notifying them that they have been associated with a freight document. If the submittedAccountEmail is not associated with an existing account, the user will be sent an email and invited to register with TransFollow.

During the creation process, the user is allowed to add attachments to a freight document using the `/freightdocuments/{freightDocumentId}/attachments` endpoint.

A transport reference can be specified on freight documents, allowing to group them as a transport (for example a mission number).

Note: A single account cannot create multiple freightdocuments with status `ISSUED` concurrently! You must create them sequentially.

put.description:
Updates a freight document. The freight document must be in `DRAFT` status.

In order to alter a freight document, you need to do the following steps to keep all information already in the freight document:
* perform a GET with this end-point
* alter the freight document as received
* PUT the whole freight document with this end-point

Some of the attributes are 'read-only' and cannot be modified. If you want to modify this freight document, the best approach is to copy and change the result from the previous GET call. You can use the PUT `/api/freightdocuments/{id}` endpoint with the resulting body.

All omitted or altered information, which is not mandatory for PUT a freight document, which was present in the freight document after the GET will not be present or is altered in the freight document after the PUT.

Adding references to a freight document is done by adding references without a `referenceId` as body to the `/api/freightdocuments/{id}` PUT. Updating an existing reference to a freight document is done by altering the reference with their `referenceId`.

patch.description:
Partial update of freight document info in ISSUED and TRANSIT status.
Only accounts which own the `SUBMITTER` role are allowed to use this endpoint.
To change the value of a field, just declare it inside the `replace` node. If a field is provided at the root of the `replace` node with a `null` value, this `null` value will be taken into account and the values of the object corresponding to the field will be erased. All omitted root fields will be ignored. When a root field is provided, such as `structuredGoodsInfo`, then all attributes of `structuredGoodsInfo` you would like to change or keep must be provided. If not, they will be set to null.

Special rules applied to the `structuredGoods` collection:
* If provided item has a `productId` that matches one on the current freight document, then it is updated but keeps the same `productId`
* If provided item does not have a `productId`, it is created with a `productId` which is calculated as the increment of the maximum value of all productIds ever used on the freight document, so that the new value won't overlap any `productId` already used in the past
* Removal of goods items is not supported by this endpoint

requestBody.description: Properties of the freight document to update.

205.description: Item not updated updated. No content.

post.description:
An account can delegate its rights of a specific role within the freight document to another account (named delegatee account):
* Submitter, consignor, consignee, carrier or other role may delegate its own role to another account.
* Submitter can delegate a role of an assigned account to its existing sub-account. In this case, Submitter needs to know exact username of such sub-account.
* All roles can delegate the `VIEWER` role: this gives the delegatee view only rights on the freight document.

In case of a role delegation other than VIEWER, the delegatee account will:
* have all rights of its delegated role within the freight document (e.g. sign a Freight Document, add comments etc).
* be able to delegate its newly received rights to a third account.

If the delegate account email address does not correspond to an existing account an email invitation will be send to the delegatee. This is similar to the new account handling for freight document roles.

If your account has the Single Sign On (SSO) feature enabled you can also use SSO group claims in the delegation calls through the `ssoGroupClaim` attribute. Accounts that do not have this feature enabled should ignore the attribute.

requestBody.description: Properties of the delegatee

post.description: Delegate multiple rights within the freight document to other accounts. This endpoint has the same functionality as the `/delegate [POST]` endpoint (see it for more details), but allows multiple delegations in one request. Any delegation already present will be skipped. All delegations must either succeed or be skipped for the request to be successful.

requestBody.description: Properties of the delegates.

post.description: Revoke the rights previously delegated to another account using the `/delegate` endpoint.

post.summary: Revoke multiple delegated freight document rights
post.description:
Revoke multiple previously delegated rights of specific roles within the freight document from other accounts. This endpoint is similar to `/revoke [POST]` but allows multiple revocations in one request. Revocations that were not delegated are ignored. All revocations must succeed or be ignored for the request to be successful.

Revoke the rights previously delegated to another account using the /delegate endpoint.

requestBody.description: Properties of the delegates.

post.description:
Create a new attachment linked to a freight document. A submitter can add `GENERAL` and `GOODS` attachment, but only when the freight document is in `DRAFT` status. The attachments of type `SUPPLEMENT` can always be added to the freight document.

If the attachment is a supplement then this attachment is not legally applied to a freight document, in other words you don't sign for those types of attachments.

attachmentId.description: Attachment id of the newly added attachment.

get.description: Get data and content of attachment for this Freight Document.

put.description:
Update an existing attachment.

If the attachment is a supplement then this attachment is not legally applied to a freight document, in other words you don't sign for the attachments.

If the old or updated attachment is not a supplement then only the submitter can update them and only when the freight document is in the `DRAFT` status.

delete.description: Delete an existing attachment. The same rules as updating an attachment apply.

post.description:
Create a new reference linked to a specific role on a freight document. Possible roles that can create / delete references are consignor, place of taking over, carrier, subsequent carrier, place of delivery and consignee. For a submitter it is not possible to create / delete references like this. A submitter can only create / delete references while the freight document is in status `DRAFT`. The submitter can use the `/freightdocuments POST` and `/freightdocuments/{id} PUT` endpoint.

The new reference is added to the list of references in the freight document resource. References created by the submitter while in `DRAFT` and references created by other roles can be distinguished by `roleId`. If the `roleId` is `null` it concerns a reference created by a submitter. If the `roleId` as a value it is a reference for a specific role.

referenceId.description: Reference id of the newly added reference.

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: The id of the freight document reference

delete.description: Delete an existing reference. Only accounts that are associated with the role linked to this reference can perform this action. For example only a carrier can delete a reference that belongs to a carrier. Submitters can only delete references while the freight document is in `DRAFT` using the `/freightdocuments POST` and `/freightdocuments/{id} PUT `endpoints. When the status of the freight document is `ISSUED` it is no longer possible for the submitter to make changes to references.

post.description: Cancels the current Freight Document, changing the `status` of the Freight Document from `DRAFT`, `ISSUED` or `TRANSIT` to `CANCELLED`. All fields documented as mandatory are applicable.

Issues the current Freight Document, changing the `status` of the Freight Document from `DRAFT` to `ISSUED`. All fields documented as mandatory are applicable. 

Note: A single account cannot create freightdocuments with status `ISSUED` concurrently! You can create them sequentially.

To prevent unauthorized requests to the `callbackUrl` use HTTP Basic Auth to secure it and specify the credentials in the optional `basicAuthCredentials` field. If specified the `POST` callback from TransFollow to the `callbackUrl` will contain the appropriate Authorization header.

post.description:
Adds a new subsequent carrier to the freight document. The body of the request must be a single `FreightDocumentRole`, see endpoint `/freightdocuments [POST]` for a description of the type. Only the `submitter` of the freight document has permission to access the endpoint.

Subsequent carriers added through this endpoint cannot be removed currently.

requestBody.description: Properties of the subsequent carrier to create.

roleId.description: The role Id of the newly added subsequent carrier.

put.description: Replace the license plates information which are associated to a role. This endpoint is restricted to the carrier roles (carrier and subsequent carrier) and the submitter of the freight document. For instance if the current user is the carrier, he can change the license plates information associated to the carrier role in the freight document. This change can be made when the freight document is in status `DRAFT`, `ISSUED` or `TRANSIT`.

requestBody.description: Properties of the license plates to update.

200.description: Update successful for an `ISSUED` or `TRANSIT` freight document.

204.description: Update successful for a `DRAFT` freight document.

put.description: Allow the submitter and the carrier to update a role after the document was `ISSUED`. The place of taking over can be changed before the document is in `TRANSIT` (before the goods have been picked up). The consignee and the place of delivery can be updated before it was `DELIVERED`. The consignee can only be changed by the submitter, not the carrier. The carrier can only update roles if configuration parameter `allowRoleUpdateForCarrier` is properly set The body of the request must be a single `FreightDocumentRole`, see endpoint `/freightdocuments [POST]` for a description.

requestBody.description: Properties of the role carrier to update.

put.description: Allow the submitter to update agreed date/time of the specific freight document. Agreed times can be updated only when the freight document is in `ISSUED` or `TRANSIT` state.

requestBody.description: Properties of the role carrier to update.

agreedDateOfDelivery.description: Same information as agreedDateTimeOfDelivery but without specifying any time. Date formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

agreedDateTimeOfDelivery.description: The planned date and time of delivery of the goods by the carrier. This is not the ETA datetime but a date that was agreed on by the relevant parties. Datetime formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

get.description:
Validates the token received by email when a new email is associated to a role of a Freight Document. The call never returns an error but provides a description of the result of the validation.

The token is validated successfully if not expired and the email linked to it has not been already used to create a new account.

The latter is due to the fact that a new email address can be linked as a role to more than one Freight Document before a new account with the same address is created. Thus only the first call will be successful.

If the token has expired, a new email containing a valid token is sent automatically by the server to the same email address.

basic_auth.description: The POST request authenticates the caller with client_id and client_secret by offering a Basic Authorization header. The Basic string is the base64 encoded form of {client_id}:{client_secret}. The authorization server requires client authentication, it will authenticate the client, and validate the user password credentials. For example, to authorize as `demo / p@55w0rd` the client would send `Authorization: Basic ZGVtbzpwQDU1dzByZA==`

anyOf.title: DOCUMENT_UPLOAD
anyOf.description: The file of a CMR is uploaded as a proof of transfer.

anyOf.title: TFA
anyOf.description: TransFollow secure electronic signature involving two registered parties equipped with devices with the TransFollow app installed

anyOf.title: OWN
anyOf.description: Implicit signature by the carrier with no signature from the counterparty.

anyOf.title: SIGNING_CODE_EMAIL
anyOf.description: Counterparty is identified by a code sent by email at signing moment (no counterparty device needed)

collection.description: Signing methods the carrier is allowed to use during collection.

carrierToCarrier.description: Signing methods the carrier is allowed to use during a carrierToCarrier transaction.

delivery.description: Signing methods the carrier is allowed to use during delivery.

anyOf.title: CARRIER_TO_CARRIER
anyOf.description: Transfer from one carrier to another

anyOf.description: Leave cargo at an intermediate location

anyOf.title: PICKUP_FROM_INTERMEDIATE
anyOf.description: Pickup cargo from an intermediate location

ssccCode.description: Serial Shipping Container Code according to SSCC-18 barcode specification.

internalCode.description: Can be used as an external identifier.

imageUrl.description: Url of the image of this returnable transport item

mandatoryArrivalTime.description: Whether the carrier is required to register arrival time during times inspection.

mandatoryDepartureTime.description: Whether the carrier is required to register departure time during times inspection.

mandatoryStartLoadingUnloadingTime.description: Whether the carrier is required to register start loading/unloading time during times inspection.

mandatoryEndLoadingUnloadingTime.description: Whether the carrier is required to register end loading/unloading time during times inspection.

mandatoryCollectionPicture.description: Whether the carrier is required to add an observation with a picture during the comments and attachments inspection when collecting the goods.

mandatoryDeliveryPicture.description: Whether the carrier is required to add an observation with a picture during the comments and attachments inspection when delivering the goods.

signingMethodsWithMandatoryPicture.description: Signing methods for which the carrier is required to add an observation with a picture.

showGoods.description: Whether goods should be reviewed by the driver in the Transfollow mobile app before signing.

showRtis.description: Whether rtis should be reviewed by the driver in the Transfollow mobile app before signing.

showTimes.description: Whether arrival/departure times should be reviewed by the driver in the Transfollow mobile app before signing.

timesConfiguration.description: Configuration of the times inspection behavior.

showReferences.description: Whether references should be reviewed by the driver in the Transfollow mobile app before signing.

showLicensePlates.description: Whether license plates should be reviewed by the driver in the Transfollow mobile app before signing.

showCommentsAndAttachments.description: Whether comments and attachments should be reviewed by the driver before signing.

commentsAndAttachmentsConfiguration.description: Configuration of the comments and attachments signing inspection behavior.

showTemperatureControl.description: Whether a temperature control should be done by the driver before signing.

showAddress.description: Whether the signing location should be reviewed by the driver before signing.

showCleaning.description: Whether the cleaning information should be reviewed by the driver before signing .

SignOnGlassConfiguration.description: Configuration of the sign on glass process. When this configuration is provided at least one of the two fields must be set to true. The TransFollow Drive App requires at least one of the fields is filled in by the signatory.

companyNameRequired.description: If enabled the name of the company is mandatory for sign on glass.

signatoryNameRequired.description: If enabled the name of the initiator party (like the driver) is mandatory for sign on glass.

SigningInstructions.description: Instructions given to the driver right at the beginning of the signing process

collection.description: Instructions displayed when starting signing for collection
collection.example: Please refer to the desk in case of dispute or call 1 800 800 800

delivery.description: Instructions displayed when starting signing for delivery
delivery.example: Make sure consignee agrees with delivered goods and then call 1 800 800 800

allowRoleUpdateForCarrier.description: Decides if the carrier can update the place of taking over and the place of delivery to a freight document in status `ISSUED` or `TRANSIT` using the mobile application. The default value is `false`.

allowRtiAddition.description: Decides if the carrier or subsequent carriers can add new returnable transport items (RTI) to a freight document in status `ISSUED` or `TRANSIT` using the mobile application. A null value will be interpreted as `false`.

availableSigningMethods.description: The signing methods the carrier is allowed to sign with.

counterpartySigningInspections.description: Inspections to be made by the counterparty when signing the freight document.

showSeals.description: Whether counterparty seals inspection is enabled.

disableContainerAddition.description: If set to `true` carrier can no longer add a container using the TFApp

disableTimesRegistration.description: If set to `true` carrier can no longer view or update the arrival time, start loading time, end loading time and departure time using the TFApp.

disableUpdatingGoodsItems.description: If set to `true` carrier can no longer edit goods items or ADRs in the TFApp.

disableUpdatingReturnableTransportItems.description: If set to `true` carrier can no longer edit RTIs in the TFApp.

excludedTransferTypes.description: Transfer types that will not be displayed as a choice for carrier when signing. Both `DELIVERY_FOR_FURTHER_INSPECTION` and `DELIVERY` can't be excluded at the same time as there would be no possibility for the driver to sign for delivery

forceCarrierSoGSignature.description: Force the Carrier to put his signature on glass when using "sign on glass" signing method. The default value is `false`.

predefinedComments.description: List of comments from which the carrier can choose when adding a new comment. The predefined text is appended to the comment text.

predefinedReturnableTransportItems.description: A list of templates for new returnable transport items that can be added by the carrier.

signingInspections.description: Inspections to be made by the carrier when signing the freight document. If none provided, the `signingInspections` values of the submitter's account settings will be used.

skipFreightDocumentDetails.description: Whether to skip the details screen when clicking on the freight document in the freight document overview in the app. The default value is `false`.

freightDocumentDetailsReadOnly.description: Whether the freight document details screen in TF Drive should be readonly to prevent the carrier from changing any data on that screen.. The default value is `false`.

skipProofOfTransfer.description: Do not display the proof of transfer code at then end of the signing process. The default value is `false`.

blockSigningOnError.description: If warnings are raised during the TFA accounts validation, then the signing process is blocked. The default value is `false`.

allowCheckIn.description: If enabled the driver can start a _check-in_ that allows him to be identified before entering the loading/unloading site. The check-in is performed separately from the signing process.

showFirstReference.description: If enabled the freight document's first reference (if it exists) is displayed in the overview and details.

excludedRtiTransferenceTypes.description: RTI transference types that will not be available for the carrier to choose in the TF Drive app when adding or updating RTIs. All types can't be excluded.

AccountLanguage.description: The language preference for the account.

acceptTermsAndConditions.description: Whether or not the user has accepted the terms and conditions

useMainAccountCreditsAllowed.description: Whether sub-account is allowed to use it's main account credits.

requiredToChangePasswordOnNextLogin.description: Whether the user must change the password on next login. The user will be prompted to change the password in the TransFollow app.

accountId.description: The unique id of the account

idCode.description: The code that will be displayed as a QRCode to identify the counterparty account when using `SIGNING_ID_CODE` signing method. This code will be automatically generated if none is provided in order to make `SIGNING_ID_CODE` signing method to be always available by default to any account.

mainAccount.description: The main account information (only available if the caller is a sub-account).

phoneNumber.description: Valid phone number format, matching the regular expression `/^[0-9+(][0-9()#.\s/ext-]{9,}$/`

signingInspections.description: Inspections to be made by the carrier in the Transfollow mobile app when signing the freight document.

username.description: The username of the account (only available if he is a sub-account).

email.description: Indicates whether notification by email is activated.

push.description: Indicates whether notification on mobile device is activated

value.description: Additional value valid only for creditsWarning that defines the number of credits below which the notification is triggered.

carrierRightsDelegatedDetailed.description: Notification when account receives carrier rights on a freightdocument.

carrierRightsRevokedDetailed.description: Notification when those rights are revoked

commentsDetailed.description: Notification when a comment is posted.

consigneeRightsDelegatedDetailed.description: Notification when account receives consignee rights on a freightdocument.

consigneeRightsRevokedDetailed.description: Notification when consignee rights are revoked.

consignorRightsDelegatedDetailed.description: Notification when account receives consignor rights on a freightdocument.

consignorRightsRevokedDetailed.description: Notification when consignor rights are revoked.

creditsTransferDetailed.description: Notification when credit balance is changed due to a credit transfer.

creditsWarningDetailed.description: Notification when credits are running out.

freightDocumentCreatedDetailed.description: Notification when freight document created and account has role on document.

placeOfDeliveryRightsDelegatedDetailed.description: Notification when account receives place of delivery rights on a freightdocument.

placeOfDeliveryRightsRevokedDetailed.description: Notification when place of delivery rights rights are revoked.

placeOfTakingOverRightsDelegatedDetailed.description: Notification when account receives place of taking over rights on a freightdocument.

placeOfTakingOverRightsRevokedDetailed.description: Notification when place of taking over rights rights are revoked.

submitterRightsDelegatedDetailed.description: Notification when account receives submitter rights on a freightdocument.

submitterRightsRevokedDetailed.description: Notification when submitter rights rights are revoked.

transferredToAnotherCarrierDetailed.description: Notification when a freight has been transferred from a carrier to another.

goodsUpdated.description: Notification when a good was updated.

pending.description: Whether the subaccount will be pending or active after creation.

accuracy.description: Accuracy of the location in meters. TF Drive App uses https://developer.android.com/reference/android/location/Location#getAccuracy()

crs.description: Coordinate reference system. Default value is "EPSG:4326".

postalBox.description: The postal box of the partner.

requiredToChangePasswordOnNextLogin.description: Whether the user must change the password on next login. The user will be prompted to change the password in the TransFollow app.

useMainAccountCreditsAllowed.description: Whether sub-account is allowed to use it's main account credits.

username.description: The username of the account (only available if he is a sub-account).

account.description: Subaccount to which the license plate belongs to.

employeeId.description: The unique identifier for the employee.

driver.description: Whether the employee is a driver.

basicAuthCredentials.description: optional credentials used during delivery of the event

username.description: The username used in basic auth header.

password.description: The password used in basic auth header.

mtlsCertificateAlias.description: mTLS certificate used for authentication with the webhook endpoint. Certificates can only be setup by TransFollow, please contact support if you want to use this functionality.

phoneNumber.description: Valid phone number format, matching the regular expression `/^[0-9+(][0-9()#.\s/ext-]{9,}$/`

emailToken.description: The email token that was sent to the email address.

acceptTermsAndConditions.description: A flag for whether the terms and conditions have been accepted. **Must be `true`**.

imageUrl.description: URL pointing to a AVC 2002 logo image (PNG only).

text.description: The AVC 2002 conditions in plain text (default) or html format.
examples: These are the conditions for avc2002.

version.description: Version of the returned terms and conditions.

language.description: Language of the returned terms and conditions.

text.description: This is the english terms and conditions.
examples: These are the conditions for avc2002.

viewPdfUrl.description: Url to open the freight document PDF for the corresponding pdfTemplateType. The url requires no authentication.

pdfTemplateType.description: The PDF template type of the freight document.

accountId.description: The unique id of the account

phoneNumber.description: Valid phone number format, matching the regular expression `/^[0-9+(][0-9()#.\s/ext-]{9,}$/`

oneOf.description: Signing code not valid for the latest version of the document.
Signing code is not valid for this document.

responseCode.description: The response code given by the counter-party of the carrier in the approval.

allContentHashes.description: In case of version 4: all the content hashes of all the freight documents over which the signature was generated

allTransFollowNumbers.description: In case of version 4: all the TransFollowNumbers of all the freight documents over which the signature was generated

documentIndex.description: In case of version 4: the index of this document within the list of freight documents over which the signature was generated

AttachmentType.description: The type of the attachment. When adding attachment to a freight document can only be one of: `SUPPLEMENT`, `GOODS`, `GENERAL`, `EDITABLE_PDF`

attachmentId.description: The unique id of the attachment.

content.description: The actual content of the attachment (2 MB maximum).. Base64 encoded jpg image. `attachment/{id}` will return the resource, `attachment/{id}/content` the content. Afterwards attachments can be uploaded (as comments) without limit. The `mimeType` field will be automatically be populated based on the content.

sealed.description: If `true`, then only parties that have attachment view permissions will be able to see the attachment. By default carriers and subsequent carriers will not have attachment view permissions if the sealed flag is set to `true`.

email.description: The email address of the signor.

attachments.description: Attachment that contains an image of the sign-on-glass signature.

signedOnGlassBy.description: The name and email address of the signor. The signor had the option to enter these fields when signing for the document.

employeeId.description: Id of the employee that signed (`null` if the employee has not been identified).

employeeName.description: Name of the employee that signed (`null` if the employee has not been identified).

signingIdCodeResult.description: Whether the employee has been identified or not.

approvedByAccount.description: The account of the user for which this approval is for.

submittedBy.description: The account that sunmitted the approval.

approvalId.description: A unique id to identify the approval.

approvalLinkId.description: A unique identifier in the scope of the freight document to be able to link to another approval on the same freight document with the same identifier. Used to group approvals that belong to the same signing moment.

commitId.description: A unique id to identify the commit.

location.description: The location where the approval took place.

missingLocationReason.description: If the `location` field is missing, this field can contain the reason why user location could not be captured.

counterpartyEanNumber.description: EAN number of the company where the signing takes place.

role.description: Role of the actor who is the author of the signature.

smdBatchSize.description: The total amount of freight documents that were signed when signing for multiple freight documents.

smdLinkId.description: A unique identifier that indicates this signature was placed when signing for multiple freight documents. When this is filled in, this signature and it's evidence are marked as the "parent".

evidence.description: Various evidence types depending on approval `type`.

submitForFurtherInspection.description: Whether the approval was submitted for the consignee to approve after inspecting the goods. This is only has an impact on the action `DELIVERY`.

external.description: Whether the approval was submitted has not been done by the system but uploaded by an external system.

accountId.description: The string value of the id of the account

addressLocation.description: GPS location of the address. Used for convenience when GPS navigation is required.

contactEmailAddress.description: In cases where the role is a company, this could be used as the contact email.

contactFaxNumber.description: In cases where the role is a company, this could be used as the contact fax number.

contactNote.description: Any additional contact information or note.

contactPhoneNumber.description: In cases where the role is a company, this could be used as the 'contact' phone number.

glnCode.description: The GS1 GLN code of the address (unique identification).

name.description: Name of the role. In the case where the role is a person, the name is in this field.

submittedAccountEmailAddress.description: This email is used to look up the account that will be associated with a role. If no account exists, then user will be sent an invitation email.

taxIdentificationNumber.description: The tax identification number of the role.

taxIdentificationNumberType.description: The tax identification number type of the role (NIF, SIREN or other).

traderIdentificationNumber.description: The trader identification number (TIN) of the role, which is used for by different authorities, such as customs or others. Example: EORI in EU.

externalIdentifier.description: Identifier that can help identify this role in an external system (for example TMS, WMS, ERP ...).

MileageUnit.description: The unit used for fields representing distance (currently kilometer and mile).

mileageAtArrival.description: Mileage when the driver arrives (stops driving in the context of this freight document).

mileageAtDeparture.description: Mileage when the driver departs (starts driving in the context of this freight document).

traversedDistance.description: The distance that has been traveled in the context of this freight document.

licensePlates.description: A collection of all license plates for the role.

GoodsDescription.description: Description of the goods item to be transported when the cleaning was performed.

IdtfCode.description: Code describing goods intended for animal feed in a bulk transport.

CleaningRegime.description: Regime of the cleaning performed on the trailer.

scheme.description: Name of the cleaning scheme the freight document should comply with (at the moment, only `QUALIMAT` is supported)

performedCleaning.description: Cleaning information related to the ongoing transport. Information usually provided by the one in charge of the cleaning.

cleaningProduct.description: Code of the detergent or disinfectant used for cleaning, if any.

previousLoads.description: List of previous transports with loads and cleaning information. Loads ordering is stored as provided in the array (from most recent to least recent)

cleaningCertificate.description: Certificate of the last cleaning performed on the trailer (attachment type is `CLEANING_CERTIFICATE`)

groupingIdentifier.description: Allows this freight document to be assigned to a specific mission. All freight documents in a transport with the same `transportReference` will be grouped under the same mission. When using the mission module, the driver will then receive a mission with all the freight documents belonging to the group. This can make the workflow of a driver easier because it is no longer needed to manually select the relevant freight documents at each loading or unloading stop..

FreightDocumentCommentEventType.description: The event during which the comment was placed.

accountId.description: The accountId logged-in user who submitted the comment.

clientMeta.description: Any additional meta data can be added to this field. This field is intended to be used by third-party applications.

commentId.description: A unique id to identify the comment.

createDateTimeClient.description: The calculated date and time when the comment was created by the client. The client sends a `secondsSinceCreation` value equal or bigger than zero as part of the POST. The backend calculates the UTC value of the moment the client actually created the comment. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ`

createDateTimeServer.description: The date and time when the comment was received by the server. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ`

creatorName.description: The name of the author who wrote the comment.

authorName.description: The name of the author who wrote the comment.

creatorRole.description: The freight document role of the logged-in user who submitted the comment.

type.description: The type of comment. It is always `LEGAL_COMMENT`.

productId.description: The structured good productId that this observation belongs to.

secondsSinceCreation.description: Number of seconds since this object was created before it was sent to the server.

clientCommitId.description: A unique identifier generated by the TfApp

timeWindow.description: The time window for picking up and/or delivering of the goods.

type.description: Type of container (e.g. 20ft Dry Van, 20ft Reefer)

verifiedGrossMass.description: Verified gross mass of the container.

verifiedGrossMassUnit.description: Weight unit of the `verifiedGrossMass`. If `verifiedGrossMass` is defined, this field is mandatory.

netWeight.description: The net weight of the container.

netWeightUnit.description: The net weight unit of the item `netWeight`.  If `netWeight` is defined, this field is mandatory.

dateTime.description: The date and time of the event formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

atDelivery.description: Temperature recorded at delivery when the refrigeration system was controlled.

atPreviousLocation.description: Temperature recorded at the previous location before delivery when the refrigeration system was controlled.

Pickup cargo from an intermediate location

FreightDocumentEventRole.description: The role which registered the event. The user has to have this role on the freight document.

location.description: The geographic location where the event has occurred.

submittedBy.description: The actor who submitted the event.

name.description: The name of the actor who submitted the event.

value.description: The value associated with the event.

HandlingInstructions.description: Instructions regarding in what circumstances the goods should be transported

controlledTemperature.description: Indication of whether or not the temperature in which the goods remain needs to be controlled

temperature.description: The temperature conditions the goods should be transported in. For example a single temperature or a temperature range and in which temperature unit (C/F)

emailAddress.description: Email address of the additional party that should be notified.

notificationTypes.description:
List of notification types that should be sent to the provided email address.
Important: if left empty, the additionalEmailNotification entry will be removed from the list.

Notifications.description: List of supplementary notifications to be sent to external parties. Only user having the role of submitter can set and get the `notifications` attribute.

additionalEmailNotifications.description: List of notification emails to be sent to each party for the corresponding notification types

submittedAccountEmailAddress.description: The email address of the account that received the delegated rights.

username.description: The username of the sub-account that received the delegated rights.

roleId.description: The roleId identifies the freight document role on which the permissions apply to.

permissions.description: A list of permission that the user has.

PdfTemplateType.description: The PDF template type of the freight document. If not provided, defaults to ECMR and can't be modified after the document is created. Note that this field only impacts the format of the downloaded PDF document and does not depend on the `type` of the document being created.

timeWindow.description: The time window for picking up and/or delivering of the goods.
The time window for picking up and/or delivering of the goods.

ReportedLocations.description: Describes some specifically recorded locations not relating to general GPS tracking.

locationCollectionCarrierArrival.description: The geographic location where the `collectionCarrierArrival` was set

locationCollectionCarrierDeparture.description: The geographic location where the `collectionCarrierDeparture` was set

locationDeliveryCarrierArrival.description: The geographic location where the `deliveryCarrierArrival` was set

locationDeliveryCarrierDeparture.description: The geographic location where the `deliveryCarrierDeparture` was set

locationLoadingStartTime.description: The geographic location where the startTime for `timeWindowOfTakingOver` was set

locationLoadingEndTime.description: The geographic location where the endTime for `timeWindowOfTakingOver` was set

locationUnloadingStartTime.description: The geographic location where the startTime for `timeWindowOfTakingOver` was set

locationUnloadingEndTime.description: The geographic location where the endTime for `timeWindowOfTakingOver` was set

allowCarrierEdit.description: Whether the carrier is allowed to modify this reference.

createdByRoleId.description: The id of the role linked to this reference or null if it is freight document / submitter role

name.description: The name (or key) of the reference value

referenceId.description: The unique id of the reference. Required when updating an existing reference. Adding references to a freight document is done by adding references without a `referenceId` as body to the `/api/freightdocuments/{id}` PUT. Updating an existing reference to a freight document is done by altering the reference with their `referenceId`.

submitterOnly.description: If true, the reference is private for the submitter. TF products won't return it to other parties. Email notifications never display it.

technical.description: If true, the reference is only returned in API calls. TF products won't display the reference at all.

mandatoryForTransferType.description: Transfer type in which filling out the reference value becomes mandatory during inspection. If defined, requires `allowCarrierEdit` to be `true`.

internalCode.description: Can be used as an external identifier.

numberOfPackagesRefusedAtDelivery.description: The number of packages refused at delivery.

netWeight.description: The net weight. If defined, net weight unit is mandatory.

netWeightUnit.description: The net weight unit of the item `weight`. If net weight is defined, this field is mandatory.

AtIssuance.description: Value of the good when the freight document has been issued.

numberOfPackages.description: The total number of packages at issuance.

weight.description: The weight at issuance. `null` if there was no weight specified.

weightUnit.description: The weight unit of the item `weight` at issuance. `null` if there was no weight specified.

netWeight.description: The net weight at issuance. `null` if there was no net weight specified.

netWeightUnit.description: The net weight unit of the item `netWeight` at issuance. `null` if there was no net weight specified.

commercialValue.description: Precision is also indicated by ISO4217.

currency.description: Value according to list ISO4217 (ISO 4217:2008). Mandatory if commercialValue is defined.

customMeasurementUnit.description: Custom measurement unit of the item custom measurement quantity.

tareWeight.description: The tare weight. If defined, tare weight unit is mandatory.

tareWeightUnit.description: The weight unit of the item `tareWeight`. If tare weight is defined, this field is mandatory.

volume.description: Total volume. If defined, volume unit is mandatory.

volumeUnit.description: The volume unit of the item `volume`. If volume is defined, this field is mandatory.

weight.description: The weight. If defined, weight unit is mandatory.

weightUnit.description: The weight unit of the item `weight`. If weight is defined, this field is mandatory.

idtfCode.description: International Database Transport for Feed number. Mandatory if cleaning scheme is `QUALIMAT`.

commercialValue.description: Precision is also indicated by ISO4217.

currency.description: Value according to list ISO4217 (ISO 4217:2008). Mandatory if commercialValue is defined.

customMeasurementUnit.description: Custom measurement unit of the item custom measurement quantity.

tareWeight.description: The tare weight. If defined, tare weight unit is mandatory.

filename.description: The actual name of the transport conditions. It is unique and used as a 'key'.

account.description: The account of the user that submitted the status update.

commitId.description: A unique id to identify the commit.

createDateTimeClient.description: The calculated date and time when the status update was created by the client. The client sends a `secondsSinceCreation` value equal or bigger than zero as part of the POST. The backend calculates the UTC value of the moment the client actually created the comment. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ`

createDateTimeServer.description: The date and time when the status update was received by the server. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ`

newFreightDocumentStatus.description: The new status that the document was changed to.

additionalDocuments.description: Collection of additional freight document PDFs.

agreedDateOfDelivery.description: Same information as agreedDateTimeOfDelivery but without specifying any time. Date formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

agreedDateOfTakingOver.description: Same information as `agreedDateTimeOfTakingOver` but without specifying any time. Date formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

agreedDateTimeOfDelivery.description: The planned date and time of delivery of the goods by the carrier. This is not the ETA datetime but a date that was agreed on by the relevant parties. Datetime formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

agreedDateTimeOfTakingOver.description: The planned date and time of taking over the goods by the carrier. This is not the ETA datetime but a date that was agreed on by the relevant parties. Datetime formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

plannedDateOfDelivery.description: Same information as plannedDateTimeOfDelivery but without specifying any time. Date formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

plannedDateOfTakingOver.description: Same information as `plannedDateTimeOfTakingOver` but without specifying any time. Date formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

plannedDateTimeOfDelivery.description: The planned date and time of delivery of the goods by the carrier. This is not the ETA datetime but a date that was planned on by the relevant parties. Datetime formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

plannedDateTimeOfTakingOver.description: The planned date and time of taking over the goods by the carrier. This is not the ETA datetime but a date that was planned on by the relevant parties. Datetime formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

approvals.description: Collection of all approvals in the freight document. See Approval definition.

attachments.description: Collection of all attachments in the freight document.

carrier.description: The carrier of the freight document.

cleaning.description: Cleaning information related to goods transport.

client.description: The client of the freight document.

containers.description: Collection of all containers in the freight document.

deliveryCarrierArrival.description: The date and time the carrier arrived at the consignee/place of delivery. A carrier or subsequent carrier can update this timestamp. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

deliveryCarrierDeparture.description: The date and time the carrier departed from the consignee/place of delivery. A carrier or subsequent carrier can update this timestamp. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

deliveryDate.description: Date of delivery. Set by the server when the document is updated as `DELIVERED`, it can't be specified or modified. Formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

establishedCountry.description: Country at which the agreement was established. Country code according to ISO 3166 - alpha-3 (ISO3 code)

establishedDate.description: Date of establishment of Transport Agreement. Formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

establishedPlace.description: Place at which the agreement was established.

estimatedDateTimeOfDelivery.description: Estimated time when cargo will be delivered. Carrier or subsequent carrier will update this timestamp every time they have new information. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

estimatedDateTimeOfTakingOver.description: Estimated time when cargo will be picked up. Carrier or subsequent carrier will update this timestamp every time they have new information. Formatted according to ISO 8601 (ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`

events.description: List of registered events (like carrier departure).

externalIdentifier.description: Custom value that is used to identify the freight document to an external system (TMS, ERP...)

freightDocumentId.description: The id of the freight document.

goods.description: Large free form text which describe the goods which should be transported. When leading spaces are needed, unicode character `U+00A0` (NO-BREAK SPACE) can be used instead of the regular space (`U+0020`). Or when `structuredGoods` are provided.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date and time when this freight document was last modified. Formatted according to ISO 8601(ISO 8601:2004): `YYYY-MM-DD`

placeOfTakingOver.description: Mandatory role which holds the cargo. Examples: The Consignor or a warehouse.

references.description: These are user generated document numbers, consisting of name-value pairs. This field allows external systems to add unique identifiers to the document.

role.description: Specify the role to be delegated.

emailAddressOfDelegatee.description:
The account that receives the delegated rights. Can be an email address of an existing TransFollow account or new account. 

Required if `username` or `ssoGroupClaim` is empty.

username.description:
The account username that receives the delegated rights. 

Required if `emailAddressOfDelegatee` or `ssoGroupClaim` is empty.

ssoGroupClaim.description:
Only for SSO enabled accounts: value of a group claim as received during the SSO authentication. The SSO user must have been authenticated by an SSO provider linked to the delegating account.

When delegating with SSO a user only gets access if the claim is correct and the user belongs to the SSO provider linked to the delegating account. Example:

  * submitter account has set up SSO using his company's Identity provider
  * submitter creates a freight document and delegates the consignor rights with `ssoGroupClaim` set to `warehouse_nl`
  * an employee from the company logs in through the SSO link of the Identity provider. The Identity provider returns a list of group claims for the user that includes `warehouse_nl`. He is therefore given access to the freight document.
  * if an employee from another company logs in they won't get access even if their group claim includes `warehouse_nl`. This is because he authenticated using an SSO provider linked to a different account.

Required if `emailAddressOfDelegatee`, `username` is empty

createdByRoleId.description: The id of the role linked to this reference or null if it is freight document / submitter role

name.description: The name (or key) of the reference value

submitterOnly.description: If true, the reference is private for the submitter. TF products won't return it to other parties. Email notifications never display it.

technical.description: If true, the reference is only returned in API calls. TF products won't display the reference at all.
